thread.title: VX Nerve Agent Found in Kim Jong Nam Death Is Among World’s Most Deadly - WSJ
thread.title_full: VX Nerve Agent Found in Kim Jong Nam Death Is Among World’s Most Deadly - WSJ

author: Jake Maxwell Watts In Kuala Lumpur
title: VX Nerve Agent Found in Kim Jong Nam Death Is Among World’s Most Deadly - WSJ
text:
Asia VX Nerve Agent Found in Kim Jong Nam Death Is Among World’s Most Deadly The U.N. has banned the weapon of mass destruction under its chemical weapons convention, which North Korea hasn’t signed By Jake Maxwell Watts in Kuala Lumpur and Jake Maxwell Watts Google+ Feb. 23, 2017 10:45 p.m. ET 
KUALA LUMPUR—The VX nerve agent that Malaysian police said Friday was used to kill Kim Jong Nam, the half brother of North Korea’s dictator, is classified as a weapon of mass destruction and is one of the most lethal chemical substances ever made, according to forensics experts. 
Even a tiny amount of VX, less than would fill a thimble, can kill. It is effective as either an odorless, tasteless gas or an amber-colored liquid and can... RELATED VIDEO North Korea Assails China for 'Dancing to U.S. Tune' North Korea appeared to lash out at Beijing Thursday in a state media commentary, despite the fact that it has long relied on China for economic and diplomatic support. WSJ's Lee Hawkins explains. Photo: Zuma Press To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
